Articles.Content: So I was talking with some folks, and a vomit animation for Kerbals came up. Does anyone else feel this is something missing from the game? You could even have it worked into tourism contracts where you are penalized for getting them sick. Thought? Complaints?

I....Im ok with this.

Gives more use to the G-meter too. As long as its more comical than gross. tourists cant EVA, so they only sit inside with helmets off, so perhaps an animation where they whip out a barf-bag?

Tourists holding vomit bags in IVA, that would be wonderful! But I think that it would be better to have some sort of reputation bonus or even a contract to make them throw up - this is Kerbal Space Program we're talking about here . In real life, a lot of people go on theme park rides that make them sick, and that doesn't put people off, surprisingly.

But if it's a VIP, I can't imagine them being happy about an uncomfortable ride like that.

This is a totally Kerbal idea!
I approve, that would be awesome. Just like in this very-well-done Fanwork Friday feature. It's the little details like that that make this wallpaper-worthy  picture so perfect:

Hmm.   Vomit bags and/or spraying the portrait screen could certainly add humour to the situation. 

This reminds me of a short documentary I saw in my late teens of a news reporter in the second seat of an RAF F4 Phantom.  The pilot 'demonstrated' some combat manoeuvres and, not surprisingly,  the reporter made very good use of the vomit bag and his running commentary lacked a certain 'professional polish'.

Is this thread supposed to be a joke?

Just in case it isn't. No, I want to see anything vomit.
Yes for vomit bags. No for vomit on the screen.

My first thought was to wonder if the animation could be done such that the Kerbal's vomiting would be slightly out of frame. Like, the Kerbal's face changes color, they get a queasy expression, then they double over, and you only see the top of their head. (implied puking).

However, this would create problems for the whole cut-away mode on crew compartments, and during IVA view.

This definitely belongs in the "mod that you could maybe download if you're really into it" category.

Tourists grabbing a barf-bag during High-G maneuvers sounds like a very reasonable compromise.
I want the barf bags.  PS the chatterer guy will hate you because he would then need to make kerbal swearwords.

6 hours ago, Rath said:

 PS the chatterer guy will hate you because he would then need to make kerbal swearwords.

And kerbal ralphing sounds, too

No vomit. No sound effect.

Thank you.

 

ME

This actually sounds like a good idea, and to be fair should impact engineers and scientists as well considering that unlike pilots, they don't have a background in flight and often the first space flight for non-flyers is a rough one. I'm fairly certain this happened to several Apollo astronauts on their way into space (I believe this nearly ended the manned test flight of the Lunar Module on Apollo 9 iirc). 

The impact should simply be that their considering "Out of Action" (O.o.A.) and can't EVA or perform tasks. Should last at most an ingame hour but say 10 in game minutes would be fine and realistic.

tl;dr I approve and would like to see this expanded to engineers and scientists as well as tourists.
